subject: Re: [junit] testing junit
msgSnippet: Hi, maybe it s just taht it s not showed here, but I don t see where you are actually calling assertionCount.testAssertionCount(). Maybe it s inside
messageBody:
Hi,

maybe it's just taht it's not showed here, but I don't see where you are
actually calling assertionCount.testAssertionCount(). Maybe it's inside
verifyAssertionCount, but else, it seems to me it normal that "the asserts
on the inner class never get run".

mathieu
----- Original Message -----
From: mhale@...
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, May 30, 2001 12:10 PM
Subject: [junit] testing junit


We are extending JUnit a bit to display a count of assertions
encountered when running a suite of tests. We can get this to work
(i.e. to display the correct number of assertions encountered), but
we want to do it right by having tests for this extension in JUnit
itself. We want to write a test like this:

(inside TestCaseTest)
public void testAssertionCount() {
TestCase assertionCount = new TestCase("assertionCount") {
protected void runTest() {
}
public void testAssertionCount(){
assertTrue(true);
assertTrue("",true);
assertEquals(true,true);
assertEquals("",true,true);
}
};
verifyAssertionCount(assertionCount);
}

The problem is that the asserts on the inner class never get run.
Does anyone know how to get this to work?
